if jobcat2 = 3 or jobcat3 = 1 or jobcat4 = 9 or jobcat5 = 1 or jobcat5 = 191 or jobcat7 = 7 or jobcat8 = 6 or jobcat8 = 31
1 CONS_CHECK_1 - In the last working week, in which of the following sites did you work?
CONS_1A On buildings, including ones under construction or renovation (1)
CONS_1B On infrastructure projects (e.g., bridges or tunnels) (2)
CONS_1D On a ship or boat (4)
CONS_1E Other type of site, please specify [Freetext] (5) ________________________________________________
If 1 = CONS_1D On a ship or boat
CHECK_1D1_1 - What types of fuel did the ships/boats that you worked on use in the last working week?
aSHP_1C Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) or propane / Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) (3)
aSHP_1D They did not use any fuel (wind, electric, solar, steam) (4)
If 1 = CONS_1D On a ship or boat
CHECK_1D1_2 - Where on the boat or land did you work?
aSHP_2C In a specific engine room (3)
RADIO_1D1_2C1 - Was the boat built before 2011?
CHECK_1D1_2C2 - How was the engine room ventilated?
aSHP_2C2A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point (1)
aSHP_2C2B By a general ventilation system (2)
aSHP_2C2C By fans in the window or doorway (3)
aSHP_2C2D By open doors or windows (4)
aSHP_2C2E No ventilation was applied to the area (5)
If 1 = CONS_1D On a ship or boat
RADIO_1D2_1 - In the last working week, did you carry out fumigation or work in an area where fumigation was carried out?
CHECK_1D2_1A1 - Where was the fumigation carried out?
aFUM_1A1A In the hold of a ship or boat (1)
RADIO_1D2_1A2 - What chemical was used for fumigation?
RADIO_1D2_1A3 - In which area did you work when fumigation was being carried out?
aFUM_1A3A Close to where the fumigation was occurring, sometimes called the risk area (1)
RADIO_1D2_1A4 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection when fumigation was being carried out?
CHECK_1D2_1A4A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aFUM_1A4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aFUM_1A4A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)
aFUM_1A4A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)
if jobcat2 = 3 or jobcat3 = 1 or jobcat4 = 9 or jobcat5 = 1 or jobcat5 = 191 or jobcat7 = 7 or jobcat8 = 6 or jobcat8 = 31
2 CONS_RADIO_2 - Was there sand dust on the sites you worked on in the last working week?
2A1 CONS_CHECK_2A1 - How was the working area cleaned of dust?
CONS_2A1B Using vacuum cleaner fitted with a HEPA filter (2)
CONS_2A1D Using a brush or sweeping the area with a broom (4)
CONS_2A1E Mopping the area with water (5)
CONS_2A1G The working area was not cleaned of dust (7)
2A2 CONS_RADIO_2A2 - In the last working week, was water spray or water suppression used to reduce the amount of dust in your work area?

3 CONS_RADIO_3 - In the last working week, did you paint, stain, varnish, polish, seal, plaster, or work with wood materials?
3A1 CONS_RADIO_3A1 - In the last working week, did you use paints, varnishes, stains or sealants, or prepare items for painting (i.e., strip or sand items)?
RADIO_3A1A1_1 - In the last working week, did you strip paint from existing surfaces?
RADIO_3A1A1_1A1 - In the last working week, did you use sanding, blasting or grinding methods to strip paint from existing surfaces?
CHECK_3A1A1_1A1A1 - Which of the following measures did you use while sanding, blasting or grinding?
aSTP_1A1A1A On-tool extraction to remove dust (1)
aSTP_1A1A1B Wet sanding, blasting or grinding (2)
RADIO_3A1A1_1A2 - In the last working week, did you strip lead-based paint?
RADIO_3A1A1_1A3 - In the last working week, did you strip old paint which was likely to have been applied before 2001?
RADIO_3A1A1_1A4 - In the last working week, where did you strip paint?
CHECK_3A1A1_1A4A1 - How was the area ventilated?
aSTP_1A4A1A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point (1)
aSTP_1A4A1B By on-tool extraction to remove dust and fumes away from your face (2)
aSTP_1A4A1C By a general ventilation system (3)
aSTP_1A4A1D By fans in the window or doorway (4)
aSTP_1A4A1E By open doors or windows (5)
aSTP_1A4A1F No ventilation was applied to the area (6)
RADIO_3A1A1_1A4B1 - Was there a ventilation system operating on the tool you used to strip paint (local exhaust ventilation or on-tool extraction)?

CHECK_3A1A1_1A5A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aSTP_1A5A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aSTP_1A5A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)
aSTP_1A5A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)

aSAN_1A1E Artificial stone such as engineered, agglomerated or reconstituted stone, also known as quartz conglomerate or quartzites, Caesarstone, Silestone, Technistone (5)
RADIO_3A1A2_1A1D1 - In the last working week, did you sand painted metal?

aSAN_1A3A A power sander or polisher (1)
aSAN_1A3B A hand sander or polisher (2)

aSAN_1A4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)

aSAN_1A4A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP) (4)

RADIO_14_1 - In the last working week, did you work with any asbestos-containing materials?

aASR_1A1A Repair or maintenance tasks (not involving removal of asbestos-containing materials) (1)
1A1A Repair or maintenance tasks (not involving removal of asbestos-containing materials)

aASR_1A1A1C Gaskets that could contain asbestos (3)
1A1A Repair or maintenance tasks (not involving removal of asbestos-containing materials)

1A1A Repair or maintenance tasks (not involving removal of asbestos-containing materials)
RADIO_14_1A1A3 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection?
CHECK_14_1A1A3A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?
aASR_1A1A3A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge (1)
aASR_1A1A3A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus) (3)

1A1A Repair or maintenance tasks (not involving removal of asbestos-containing materials)
CHECK_14_1A1A4 - How did you clean up the dust in the last working week?
aASR_1A1A4B Using vacuum cleaner fitted with a HEPA filter (2)
aASR_1A1A4D Using a brush or sweeping the area with a broom (4)
aASR_1A1A4E Mopping the area with water (5)
aASR_1A1A4G The working area was not cleaned of dust (7)
CHECK_14_1A1B1 - Which of the following asbestos-containing materials did you remove?
aASR_1A1B1A Fibro (fibrous cement) sheet (external cladding, roofing, pipes, internal wet-area lining sheets) (1)
aASR_1A1B1B Asbestos cavity insulation (from wall or ceiling cavities in buildings) (2)
aASR_1A1B1C Fire rated board or millboard (3)
aASR_1A1B1E Any asbestos-containing material from onboard a ship, train or other mobile plant (5)
aASR_1A1B1F Lagging/insulation from boilers/ovens/furnaces or similar fixed plant (6)
aASR_1A1B1H Road paving or asphalt containing asbestos (8)
CHECK_14_1A1B2 - In the last working week, did you use any of the following methods to remove the asbestos containing materials?
aASR_1A1B2B Saturation and water injection method (2)
aASR_1A1B2D Hammering or using power tools (e.g. disc cutters, saws, etc) (4)
RADIO_14_1A1B3 - In the last working week, was the asbestos removal work done inside an enclosure?
RADIO_14_1A1B3A1 - Was the enclosure under negative pressure?
RADIO_14_1A1B3A1A1 - Did you do a preliminary decontamination of personal protective equipment (PPE) before leaving the enclosure?
RADIO_14_1A1B4 - In the last working week, was there a decontamination unit (DCU) on site so that you could shower and decontaminate fully?
CHECK_14_1A1B5 - In the last working week, what protective clothing did you wear when removing asbestos-containing materials?
RADIO_14_1A1B6 - Did you shower before or after removing PPE?
RADIO_14_1A1B7 - In the last working week, what was the last item of PPE you removed following work?
RADIO_14_1A1B8 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protective equipment when removing the asbestos containing materials?
CHECK_14_1A1B8A1 - What type of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use when removing the asbestos-containing materials in the last working week?
aASR_1A1B8A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle filter (P3) or a cartridge (1)
